trans-unit.source: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView"></xref> control.

In a visual designer, when you switch to a designer view (such as **Design** view in [!INCLUDE[vs_current_short](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)]), the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control markup is parsed.
A design-time version of the control is then created on the design surface.
When you switch to source view, the design-time control is persisted as the markup for the Web page.

The properties of the ListViewDesigner class provide the following functionality: - The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListViewDesigner.ActionLists%2A> property returns a list of items that are used to create a smart tag panel.

- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListViewDesigner.SampleRowCount%2A> property returns the number of records that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control displays on the design surface.

- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListViewDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property always returns `true`, which indicates that the designer creates a temporary copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> to generate the design-time markup.

The methods of the ListViewDesigner class provide the following functionality: - The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListViewDesigner.GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml%2A> methods return the HTML markup that is used to render the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control at design time.

- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListViewDesigner.GetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListViewDesigner.SetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> methods provide support for editable regions at design time.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListViewDesigner.Initialize%2A> method prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListViewDesigner"></xref> class.

The [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] internally creates a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListViewDesigner> class when it creates the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control or a copy of that control on the design surface.
Gets the list of items that are is used to create a smart tag panel for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView"></xref> control.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection"></xref> object that is associated with this designer.
Generates the HTML markup that is used to render the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView"></xref> control at design time.

If the two required templates for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control (<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.LayoutTemplate%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.ItemTemplate%2A?displayProperty=fullName>) are not defined, the GetDesignTimeHtml method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListViewDesigner.GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml%2A> method to generate the HTML markup.
The HTML markup that is used to render the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView"></xref> control at design time.

Generates the HTML markup that is used to render the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView"></xref> control at design time, and populates the specified collection with the currently selected designer region.
A collection of designer regions for the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView"></xref> control.
The HTML markup that is used to render the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView"></xref> control at design time.
Returns the content for the specified editable region of the design-time view of the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView"></xref> control.
The GetEditableDesignerRegionContent method overrides the default implementation to support region-based editing on the design surface and to return the content for a specified region.
The region to get the content for.
The HTML markup for the region.
Generates the HTML markup that represents a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView"></xref> control at design time that has no visual representation at run time.

The GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml method is used by the designer to render the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control at design time if the two required templates for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control (<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.LayoutTemplate%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.ItemTemplate%2A?displayProperty=fullName>) are not defined.

The GetEmptyDesignTimeHtml method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.CreatePlaceHolderDesignTimeHtml%28System.String%29> method to create a placeholder that displays the type and the ID of the control, and additional instructions for the user.
The HTML markup that represents a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView"></xref> control at design time.
Initializes the control designer and loads the specified control.
The designer host calls the Initialize method when it is ready to use the designer to render the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control.
The Initialize method and its base methods configure properties and connect to events that are required for the designer.
The `component` parameter is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control that is associated with this designer, or a copy of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control.
The control that is being designed.
Occurs when the associated control changes.
The OnComponentChanged method overrides its base implementation to ignore change notifications while persisting a template's content in the page markup.
The source of the event.
The event data.
Prevents the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView"></xref> control from updating when the data source schema is refreshed in the HTML designer.

The OnSchemaRefreshed method notifies control designer object for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control that is bound to the associated data source that the fields in the schema have changed.
When this method is called, it prevents the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control from updating itself.
Gets the number of records that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView"></xref> control displays on the design surface.
The SampleRowCount property always returns 21.
This causes 21 records to be displayed in the design surface for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control.

An exception is if there is a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager> control inside the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.LayoutTemplate%2A?displayProperty=fullName> template and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.PageSize%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is set to a value less than 21.
In that case, the number of records to display is the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataPager.PageSize%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
The maximum number of records that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control will display on the designer surface is 21 records.
The number of records that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView"></xref> control displays on the design surface.
Specifies the content for an editable region of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView"></xref> control at design time.
An editable design region that is contained in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView"></xref> control.
The content to assign for the editable design region.

Gets a value that indicates whether the designer should use a temporary copy instead of the actual <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView"></xref> control that is associated with the designer in order to generate the design-time markup.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> in all cases.
